bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton, March 31, 1892
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, March 31, 1892.

Mr Beverly Y. Payne,
To the Department of State.
Accounts and returns for the quarter ending March 31, 1892.

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, March 31, 1892.

Hon., William F. Wharton,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.
I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith, the Accounts and returns of this Consulate General for the quarter ending March 31, 1892, as per subjoined list of enclosures.

I have the honor to be,
Sir:
Your obedient Servant,
Beverly Y. Payne,
U.S. Vice Consul.

1. Digest of invoice book
2. Record of notarial service
3. Record of Treasury fees with oath.
4. Statement of Contingent Expenses
5. Abstract of Contingent Expenses & vouchers (8)
6. Salary Account
